anvil.description:
A simple anvil.
You can upgrade your tools with it.
anvil.mail: This old anvil has been sitting around the guild for years, maybe you can smith yourself something with it. Check the manual I added if you're unsure how.^^-Marlon^P.S. Let's keep this between us.^^(activate the anvil without holding anything) %item id {{item}} 1 %%[#]Smith's Anvil
anvil.page.title: Smithing Notes
anvil.page.body: Smithing Manual^With the anvil you can improve tools or break geodes.^^How to Use:^Hold the tool you want to improve and carry the required materials. Take your time and aim for precise strikes: if you strike true, you might even save up some materials... but if your hand slips, you might end up wasting them all, and your tool will be none the better.^^^Axe Upgrades:^* Base Axe > Copper Axe: {{Axe_0_amount}} × {{Axe_0_item}}^* Copper Axe > Steel Axe: {{Axe_1_amount}} × {{Axe_1_item}}^* Steel Axe > Gold Axe: {{Axe_2_amount}} × {{Axe_2_item}}^* Gold Axe > Iridium Axe: {{Axe_3_amount}} × {{Axe_3_item}}^^Pickaxe Upgrades:^* Base Pickaxe > Copper Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_0_amount}} × {{Pickaxe_0_item}}^* Copper Pickaxe > Steel Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_1_amount}} × {{Pickaxe_1_item}}^* Steel Pickaxe > Gold Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_2_amount}} × {{Pickaxe_2_item}}^* Gold Pickaxe > Iridium Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_3_amount}} × {{Pickaxe_3_item}}^Hoe Upgrades:^* Base Hoe > Copper Hoe: {{Hoe_0_amount}} × {{Hoe_0_item}}^* Copper Hoe > Steel Hoe: {{Hoe_1_amount}} × {{Hoe_1_item}}^* Steel Hoe > Gold Hoe: {{Hoe_2_amount}} × {{Hoe_2_item}}^* Gold Hoe > Iridium Hoe: {{Hoe_3_amount}} × {{Hoe_3_item}}^^Watering Can Upgrades:^* Base Can > Copper Can: {{WateringCan_0_amount}} × {{WateringCan_0_item}}^* Copper Can > Steel Can: {{WateringCan_1_amount}} × {{WateringCan_1_item}}^* Steel Can > Gold Can: {{WateringCan_2_amount}} × {{WateringCan_2_item}}^* Gold Can > Iridium Can: {{WateringCan_3_amount}} × {{WateringCan_3_item}}^^Trash Can Upgrades (hold any trash item):^* Base > Copper: {{Trash_0_amount}} × {{Trash_0_item}}^* Copper > Steel: {{Trash_1_amount}} × {{Trash_1_item}}^* Steel > Gold: {{Trash_2_amount}} × {{Trash_2_item}}^* Gold > Iridium: {{Trash_3_amount}} × {{Trash_3_item}}^^Pan Upgrades:^* Pan > Steel Pan: {{Pan_1_amount}} × {{Pan_1_item}}^* Steel Pan > Gold Pan: {{Pan_2_amount}} × {{Pan_2_item}}^* Gold Pan > Iridium Pan: {{Pan_3_amount}} × {{Pan_3_item}}^^Fishing Rod Upgrades:^* Bamboo Pole > Training Rod: {{Rod_0_amount}} × {{Rod_0_item}}^* Training Rod > Fiberglass Rod: {{Rod_1_amount}} × {{Rod_1_item}}^* Fiberglass Rod > Iridium Rod: {{Rod_2_amount}} × {{Rod_2_item}}^* Iridium Rod > Advanced Iridium Rod: {{Rod_3_amount}} × {{Rod_3_item}}^^Scythe Upgrades:^* Scythe > Golden Scythe: {{Scythe_0_amount}} × {{Scythe_0_item}}^* Golden Scythe > Iridium Scythe: {{Scythe_1_amount}} × {{Scythe_1_item}}^^Backpack Expansions:^* First expansion: {{Bag_12_amount}} × {{Bag_12_item}}^* Second expansion: {{Bag_24_amount}} × {{Bag_24_item}}^^Breaking Stones:^* Bring a geode or mystery box to the anvil to break it open.^^^^^Trinket Upgrade:^* Cost: {{Trinket_0_amount}} × {{Trinket_0_item}}^* Upgrading always yields a better version of the trinket used (original ranks and requirements still apply).^* Magic Quivers can become Rapid, Heavy, or Perfect. Perfect is the highest rank and cannot be upgraded further.^^^^The more skilled you are the easier it gets:^* Foraging: Axe^* Mining: Pickaxe, Pan^* Farming: Hoe, Watering Can^* Fishing: Fishing Rod^* Combat: Trinket^* Overall experience: Trash Can, Backpack
anvil.page.body.no-training-rod: Smithing Manual^With the anvil you can improve tools or break geodes.^^How to Use:^Hold the tool you want to improve and carry the required materials. Take your time and aim for precise strikes: if you strike true, you might even save up some materials... but if your hand slips, you might end up wasting them all, and your tool will be none the better.^^^Axe Upgrades:^* Base Axe > Copper Axe: {{Axe_0_amount}} × {{Axe_0_item}}^* Copper Axe > Steel Axe: {{Axe_1_amount}} × {{Axe_1_item}}^* Steel Axe > Gold Axe: {{Axe_2_amount}} × {{Axe_2_item}}^* Gold Axe > Iridium Axe: {{Axe_3_amount}} × {{Axe_3_item}}^^Pickaxe Upgrades:^* Base Pickaxe > Copper Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_0_amount}} × {{Pickaxe_0_item}}^* Copper Pickaxe > Steel Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_1_amount}} × {{Pickaxe_1_item}}^* Steel Pickaxe > Gold Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_2_amount}} × {{Pickaxe_2_item}}^* Gold Pickaxe > Iridium Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_3_amount}} × {{Pickaxe_3_item}}^Hoe Upgrades:^* Base Hoe > Copper Hoe: {{Hoe_0_amount}} × {{Hoe_0_item}}^* Copper Hoe > Steel Hoe: {{Hoe_1_amount}} × {{Hoe_1_item}}^* Steel Hoe > Gold Hoe: {{Hoe_2_amount}} × {{Hoe_2_item}}^* Gold Hoe > Iridium Hoe: {{Hoe_3_amount}} × {{Hoe_3_item}}^^Watering Can Upgrades:^* Base Can > Copper Can: {{WateringCan_0_amount}} × {{WateringCan_0_item}}^* Copper Can > Steel Can: {{WateringCan_1_amount}} × {{WateringCan_1_item}}^* Steel Can > Gold Can: {{WateringCan_2_amount}} × {{WateringCan_2_item}}^* Gold Can > Iridium Can: {{WateringCan_3_amount}} × {{WateringCan_3_item}}^^Trash Can Upgrades (hold any trash item):^* Base > Copper: {{Trash_0_amount}} × {{Trash_0_item}}^* Copper > Steel: {{Trash_1_amount}} × {{Trash_1_item}}^* Steel > Gold: {{Trash_2_amount}} × {{Trash_2_item}}^* Gold > Iridium: {{Trash_3_amount}} × {{Trash_3_item}}^^Pan Upgrades:^* Pan > Steel Pan: {{Pan_1_amount}} × {{Pan_1_item}}^* Steel Pan > Gold Pan: {{Pan_2_amount}} × {{Pan_2_item}}^* Gold Pan > Iridium Pan: {{Pan_3_amount}} × {{Pan_3_item}}^^Fishing Rod Upgrades:^*Bamboo Pole > Fiberglass Rod: {{Rod_1_amount}} × {{Rod_1_item}}^*Fiberglass Rod > Iridium Rod: {{Rod_2_amount}} × {{Rod_2_item}}^*Iridium Rod > Advanced Iridium Rod: {{Rod_3_amount}} × {{Rod_3_item}}^^Scythe Upgrades:^* Scythe > Golden Scythe: {{Scythe_0_amount}} × {{Scythe_0_item}}^* Golden Scythe > Iridium Scythe: {{Scythe_1_amount}} × {{Scythe_1_item}}^^^Backpack Expansions:^* First expansion: {{Bag_12_amount}} × {{Bag_12_item}}^* Second expansion: {{Bag_24_amount}} × {{Bag_24_item}}^^Breaking Stones:^* Bring a geode or mystery box to the anvil to break it open.^^^^^Trinket Upgrade:^* Cost: {{Trinket_0_amount}} × {{Trinket_0_item}}^* Upgrading always yields a better version of the trinket used (original ranks and requirements still apply).^* Magic Quivers can become Rapid, Heavy, or Perfect. Perfect is the highest rank and cannot be upgraded further.^^^^The more skilled you are the easier it gets:^* Foraging: Axe^* Mining: Pickaxe, Pan^* Farming: Hoe, Watering Can^* Fishing: Fishing Rod^* Combat: Trinket^* Overall experience: Trash Can, Backpack
tool.cant-upgrade: I don't think this can be upgraded at all.
tool.empty: You need to equip a tool.
tool.disabled: I can't improve this tool any further at its current level.
tool.max-level: This tool is already at the highest upgrade level.
tool.missing-materials: You need {{ItemAmount}} {{itemName}} to perform the upgrade.
tool.upgraded-critical: Your {{toolType}} was upgraded with maximum efficiency!
geode.menu-desc:
Opening geodes... How hard can it be?

I can do it myself!
menu.minigame-cooldown-tooltip: Speed at which the power meter drops during cooldown (0 to disable)
menu.minigame-hint-marker-tooltip: Show a marker indicating the last hit position
menu.minigame-popup-text-tooltip: Give feedback with text like 'Good' or 'Miss' indicating hit quality each hit
menu.allow-fail-tooltip: Lose materials without upgrading your tool.
menu.material-text: Enter Item IDs and quantities. Set quantity to 0 for free upgrades.
menu.geode-amount-to-open-tooltip: Recommend 20 or less to avoid lose of items
